text: It's a good thing to be satisfied with what one has.
author: The Buddha

text: To support mother and father, to cherish partner and children, and to be engaged in peaceful occupation — this is the greatest blessing.
author: The Buddha

text: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
author: The Buddha

text: Purity and impurity depend on oneself; no one can purify another.

text: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.

text: Meditate … do not delay, lest you later regret it.
author: The Buddha

text: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.
author: The Buddha

text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
author: The Buddha

text: A noble one produces an abundance of merit by having a compassionate mind towards all living beings.

text: Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.
author: The Buddha

text: Delight in heedfulness! Guard well your thoughts!
author: The Buddha

text: A wise person should be urgently moved on occasions that make for urgency.
author: The Buddha

text: Give, even if you only have a little.
author: The Buddha

text: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.
author: The Buddha

text: I do not dispute with the world; rather it is the world that disputes with me.
author: The Buddha

text: A disciplined mind brings happiness.
author: The Buddha

text: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.
author: The Buddha

text: Both formerly and now, it is only suffering that I describe, and the cessation of suffering.
author: The Buddha

text: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
author: The Buddha

text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
author: The Buddha

text: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
author: The Buddha

text: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.

text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.

text: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.

text: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.

text: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.

text: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.

text: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.

text: You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.

text: I am an optimist. It does not seem too much use being anything else.

text: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.

text: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.

text: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.

text: We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out.

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right.

text: In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.

text: If you're changing the world, you're working on important things. You're excited to get up in the morning.

text: The biggest room in the world is room for improvement.

text: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.

text: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.

text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.

text: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.

text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.

text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.

text: Truth is powerful and it prevails.

text: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.

text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.

text: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

text: A man who doesn't trust himself can never really trust anyone else.

text: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.

text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.

text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.

text: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.

text: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.

text: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.

text: Nothing will work unless you do.

text: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.

text: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.

text: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.

text: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.

text: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.

text: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.

text: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.

text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Cicero

text: What worries you masters you.
author: Haddon Robinson

text: One should not hurt others if one loves oneself.

text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
author: Karl Menninger

text: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
author: Democritus

text: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.

text: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than you and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.

text: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

text: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.

text: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.

text: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, we must be busy when the corn is ripe.
author: Torquato Tasso

text: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.

text: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

text: Don't smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.

text: That's the risk you take if you change: that people you've been involved with won't like the new you. But other people who do will come along.

text: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.

text: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
author: Edward Everett Hale

text: Yesterday's home runs don't win today's games.
author: Babe Ruth

text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but simply moving on with dignity despite that fear.

text: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William C. Menninger

text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
author: Hubert Humphrey

text: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato

text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: Jerome

text: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
author: Willa Cather

text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Basil of Caesarea

text: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
author: Pema Chödrön

text: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.

text: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.

text: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.

text: I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.

text: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.

text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.

text: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.

text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.

text: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.

text: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.

text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavors to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

text: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself, and not by borrowing.

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.

text: I have often regretted my speech, never my silence.

text: You teach best what you most need to learn.

text: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.

text: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.

text: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.

text: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.

text: Computers are like bikinis. They save people a lot of guesswork.

text: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.

text: If you want to go east, don't go west.

text: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.

text: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.

text: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.

text: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.

text: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.

text: Never mistake motion for action.

text: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

text: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what a man or woman is able to do that counts.

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

text: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.

text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.

text: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.

text: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.

text: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.

text: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.

text: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.

text: You win the victory when you yield to friends.

text: Friendship is Love without his wings!

text: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.

text: You got to be careful if you don't know where you're going, because you might not get there.

text: The truth is not for all men, but only for those who seek it.

text: We do not quit playing because we grow old, we grow old because we quit playing.

text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.

text: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.

text: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.

text: The human spirit must prevail over technology.

text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.

text: Never do things others can do and will do, if there are things others cannot do or will not do.

text: Experience is not what happens to a man. It is what a man does with what happens to him.

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

text: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.

text: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.

text: The best way out is always through.

text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.

text: It is on our failures that we base a new and different and better success.

text: The really unhappy person is the one who leaves undone what they can do, and starts doing what they don't understand; no wonder they come to grief.

text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

text: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.

text: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.

text: I believe that we are fundamentally the same and have the same basic potential.

text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.

text: If it turns out that there is a God, I don't think that he's evil. But the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.

text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.

text: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.

text: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.

text: Technology has to be invented or adopted.

text: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.

text: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, can never know what true friendship means.

text: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.

text: What is not started today is never finished tomorrow.

text: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.

text: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.

text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.

text: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.

text: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.

text: It is not so important to know everything as to appreciate what we learn.

text: The greatest achievement of humanity is not its works of art, science, or technology, but the recognition of its own dysfunction.

text: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.

text: The most successful people are those who are good at plan B.

text: We are all something, but none of us are everything.

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.

text: Love doesn't make the world go round; love is what makes the ride worthwhile.

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.

text: Change in all things is sweet.

text: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.

text: Life's challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they're supposed to help you discover who you are.

text: Allow the world to live as it chooses, and allow yourself to live as you choose.

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ‘Til your good is better and your better is best.

text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

text: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.

text: He who knows himself is enlightened.

text: Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events, not of words. Trust movement.

text: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.

text: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.

text: Everything in the universe goes by indirection. There are no straight lines.

text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.

text: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.

text: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.

text: Before you put on a frown, make absolutely sure there are no smiles available.

text: By oneself is evil done; by oneself is one defiled. By oneself is evil left undone; by oneself is one made pure.

text: I allow my intuition to lead my path.

text: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.

text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise.

text: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.

text: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.

text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.

text: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.

text: The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it.

text: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.

text: We lost because we told ourselves we lost.

text: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.

text: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.

text: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.

text: Whoso loves, believes the impossible.

text: Love has no age, no limit; and no death.

text: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.

text: I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.

text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are small matters compared to what lies within us.

text: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all.

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.

text: The winner ain't the one with the fastest car it's the one who refuses to lose.

text: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.

text: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: Robert Frost

text: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to deceive!
author: Walter Scott

text: All the world is a stage, And all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and entrances; Each man in his time plays many parts.
author: William Shakespeare

text: We must never forget that it is through our actions, words, and thoughts that we have a choice.

text: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
author: Lucille Ball

text: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.

text: Trust your own instinct. Your mistakes might as well be your own, instead of someone else's.

text: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.

text: It's important to know that words don't move mountains. Work, exacting work moves mountains.

text: Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you're not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.

text: The great myth of our times is that technology is communication.

text: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.

text: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.

text: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.

text: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.

text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

text: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
author: John Locke

text: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: Skill to do comes of doing.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Conflict is the gadfly of thought. It stirs us to observation and memory. It instigates to invention. It shocks us out of sheeplike passivity, and sets us at noting and contriving.
author: John Dewey

text: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.
author: Aristotle

text: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Technology is the campfire around which we tell our stories.

text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Adversity causes some men to break, others to break records.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
author: John Locke

text: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The World is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

text: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
author: Jim Rohn

text: You cannot have what you do not want.
author: John Acosta

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The word philosophy sounds high-minded, but it simply means the love of wisdom. If you love something, you don't just read about it; you hug it, you mess with it, you play with it, you argue with it.

text: TV and the Internet are good because they keep stupid people from spending too much time out in public.
author: Douglas Coupland

text: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
author: Cicero

text: You should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body, and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time. That’s how to get rid of resentment for that person.
author: The Buddha

text: Who looks outside, dreams, who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

text: No person is your friend who demands your silence or denies your right to grow.
author: Alice Walker

text: Consider that not only do negative thoughts and emotions destroy our experience of peace, but they also undermine our health.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: In order to live free and happily you must sacrifice boredom. It is not always an easy sacrifice.
author: Richard Bach

text: And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: To be beautiful means to be yourself. You don't need to be accepted by others. You need to accept yourself.

text: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
author: Vusi Mahlasela

text: You're never a loser until you quit trying.

text: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
author: Albert Camus

text: Friendship brings in a lot of honesty and trust into any relationship, especially a marriage.
author: Farhan Akhtar

text: Friendships are the family we make - not the one we inherit. I've always been someone to whom friendship, elective affinities, is as important as family.

text: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
author: Francis Bacon

text: This is why I loved technology: if you used it right, it could give you power and privacy.
author: Cory Doctorow

text: In romance, we feel the need to zoom in and expound on our partner's foibles in intimate detail; in friendship, we tend to do the opposite, avoiding confrontation through fear, lethargy or both.

text: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.

text: They can do all because they think they can.
author: Virgil

text: Trust your hunches. They're usually based on facts filed away just below the conscious level.
author: Joyce Brothers

text: I always wanted to be somebody, but I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: I love you the more in that I believe you had liked me for my own sake and for nothing else.
author: John Keats

text: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
author: Jane Austen

text: Silence is deep as Eternity; Speech is shallow as Time.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens.
author: Ellen Glasgow

text: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.

text: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
author: Sam Walton

text: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.

text: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them to become what they are capable of being.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?
author: Joe Namath

text: Keep silence for the most part, and speak only when you must, and then briefly.
author: Epictetus

text: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.

text: I cannot make my days longer, so I strive to make them better.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The world turns aside to let any man pass who knows where he is going.
author: Epictetus

text: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darkness of other people.
author: Carl Jung

text: What matters is the value we've created in our lives, the people we've made happy and how much we've grown as people.

text: I, too, do not envision a doctrine of self the clinging to which there would not arise sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.
author: The Buddha

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.

text: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

text: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Before you can inspire with emotion, you must be swamped with it yourself. Before you can move their tears, your own must flow. To convince them, you must yourself believe.

text: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
author: Susan Orlean

text: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: If you break your neck, if you have nothing to eat, if your house is on fire, then you got a problem. Everything else is inconvenience.

text: People are so constituted that everybody would rather undertake what they see others do, whether they have an aptitude for it or not.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
author: Margaret Thatcher

text: The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.
author: John Lasseter

text: I have learned that friendship isn't about who you've known the longest, it's about who came and never left your side.
author: Yolanda Hadid

text: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.

text: Don't look back. Something might be gaining on you.
author: Satchel Paige

text: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: If you seek truth, you will not seek victory by dishonorable means, and if you find truth you will become invincible.
author: Epictetus

text: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
author: Confucius

text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: If one does not know to which port is sailing, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca the Younger

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
author: Richard Bach

text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: Don’t sacrifice your own welfare for that of another, no matter how great. Realizing your own true welfare, be intent on just that.
author: The Buddha

text: Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
author: Demosthenes

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: A goal without a plan is just a wish.

text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.

text: Once you label me you negate me.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
author: Bill Bradley

text: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.

text: Be like the flower, turn your face to the sun.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: When you doubt your power, you give power to your doubt.
author: Honoré de Balzac

text: The noblest worship is to make yourself as good and as just as you can.
author: Isocrates

text: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

text: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

text: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: Bernard Shaw

text: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.

text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.

text: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

text: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
author: Plato

text: Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years.
author: Richard Bach

text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.

text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
author: Laozi

text: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

text: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: Wisdom is found only in truth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

text: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.

text: All of our technology is completely unnecessary to a happy life.
author: Tom Hodgkinson

text: It isn't where you come from, it's where you're going that counts.
author: Ella Fitzgerald

text: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.

text: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
author: Cicero

text: Even an animal, if you show genuine affection, gradually trust develops... If you always showing bad face and beating, how can you develop friendship?
author: Dalai Lama

text: The greatest minds are capable of the greatest vices as well as of the greatest virtues.
author: René Descartes

text: Technology… is a queer thing. It brings you great gifts with one hand, and it stabs you in the back with the other.
author: Carrie Snow

text: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
author: Gordon Hinckley

text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

text: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.

text: Formula for success: under promise and over deliver.
author: Tom Peters

text: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.

text: Technology frightens me to death. It's designed by engineers to impress other engineers. And they always come with instruction booklets that are written by engineers for other engineers — which is why almost no technology ever works.

text: He who hath many friends hath none.
author: Aristotle

text: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.

text: Friendship, like the immortality of the soul, is too good to be believed.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: All I required to be happy was friendship and people I could admire.
author: Christian Dior

text: Technology presumes there's just one right way to do things and there never is.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

text: If we are not given the chance to forget, we are also not given the chance to recover our memories, to alter them with time, perspective, and wisdom. Forgetting, we can be ourselves beyond what the past has told us we are; we can evolve. That is the possibility we want from the future.

text: Appearances are often deceiving.
author: Aesop

text: I think that novels that leave out technology misrepresent life as badly as Victorians misrepresented life by leaving out sex.

text: The future is completely open, and we are writing it moment to moment.

text: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it's best to let him run.

text: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.

text: Your friend is your needs answered.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.

text: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.

text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

text: To change one's life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.

text: All this modern technology just makes people try to do everything at once.

text: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: One that desires to excel should endeavor in those things that are in themselves most excellent.

text: I think and that is all that I am.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A lot of times people look at the negative side of what they feel they can't do. I always look on the positive side of what I can do.

text: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.

text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

text: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!

text: The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress.

text: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.

text: The most important thing is transforming our minds, for a new way of thinking, a new outlook: we should strive to develop a new inner world.

text: We must not say every mistake is a foolish one.
author: Cicero

text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.

text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: None knows the weight of another's burden.
author: George Herbert

text: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.

text: They can conquer who believe they can.
author: Virgil

text: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.

text: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.

text: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.

text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.

text: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.

text: Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. And today? Today is a gift. That is why we call it the present.

text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.

text: It is the quality of our work which will please God, not the quantity.

text: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world.

text: Almost everything comes from nothing.

text: In the end we retain from our studies only that which we practically apply.

text: One needs something to believe in, something for which one can have whole-hearted enthusiasm. One needs to feel that one's life has meaning, that one is needed in this world.

text: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.

text: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.

text: All this worldly wisdom was once the unamiable heresy of some wise man.

text: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.

text: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.

text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.

text: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.

text: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.

text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.

text: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.

text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.

text: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'

text: Always tell the truth. That way, you don't have to remember what you said.

text: Men of perverse opinion do not know the excellence of what is in their hands, till someone dash it from them.

text: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.

text: Genuine love should first be directed at oneself; if we do not love ourselves, how can we love others?

text: Make the best use of what is in your power and take the rest as it happens.

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, nor touched... but are felt in the heart.

text: If you must tell me your opinions, tell me what you believe in. I have plenty of doubts of my own.

text: We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.

text: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.

text: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands.

text: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

text: I never worry about action, but only inaction.

text: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.

text: If you have one true friend, you have more than your share.

text: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.

text: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.

text: I don't want to achieve immortality through my work... I want to achieve it through not dying.

text: I was thrown out of college for cheating on the metaphysics exam; I looked into the soul of the boy sitting next to me.

text: Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.

text: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Aerodynamically the bumblebee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumblebee doesn't know that, so it goes on flying anyway.

text: Happiness is the reward we get for living to the highest right we know.

text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.

text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.

text: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or airplane or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
author: John Burroughs

text: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.

text: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
author: Leonard Nimoy

text: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

text: Constant kindness can accomplish much. As the sun makes ice melt, kindness causes misunderstanding, mistrust, and hostility to evaporate.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Heedfulness is the path to the Deathless. Heedlessness is the path to death. The heedful die not. The heedless are as if already dead.
author: The Buddha

text: The only person who never makes mistakes is the person who never does anything.
author: Denis Waitley

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: To be happy is to be able to become aware of oneself without fright.
author: Walter Benjamin

text: Ideals are an imaginative understanding of that which is desirable in that which is possible.
author: Walter Lippmann

text: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
author: Winston Churchill

text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.

text: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: No one has ever become poor by giving.
author: Anne Frank

text: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
author: Charles Du Bos

text: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
author: Confucius

text: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: Things turn out best for those who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: Jack Buck

text: Everything that happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert Schuller

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
author: Albert Einstein

text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
author: Baltasar Gracián

text: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
author: George Herbert

text: All phenomena are preceded by the mind, created by the mind, and have the mind as their master.
author: The Buddha

text: Do I speak at the right time, or not? Do I speak of facts, or not? Do I speak gently or harshly? Do I speak profitable words or not? Do I speak with a kindly heart, or inwardly malicious?
author: The Buddha

text: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams, who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

text: The superior man is modest in his speech but exceeds in his actions.
author: Confucius

text: When you meet someone better than yourself, turn your thoughts to becoming his equal. When you meet someone not as good as you are, look within and examine your own self.
author: Confucius

text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
author: Henry K. Beecher

text: The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
author: Henry Miller

text: Learning is finding out what you already know.
author: Richard Bach

text: If you find yourself in a hole, the first thing to do is stop digging.
author: Will Rogers

text: I can, therefore I am.
author: Simone Weil

text: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: The ultimate promise of technology is to make us master of a world that we command by the push of a button.
author: Volker Grassmuck

text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

text: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
author: Seneca the Younger

text: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?
author: Woody Allen

text: Criticism is something you can easily avoid by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.
author: Aristotle

text: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
author: The Buddha

text: Error is discipline through which we advance.
author: William Ellery Channing

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

text: There is no retirement for an artist, it's your way of living so there is no end to it.
author: Henry Moore

text: Fortune befriends the bold.
author: John Dryden

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: He can who thinks he can, and he can't who thinks he can't. This is an inexorable, indisputable law.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: In order to win, you must expect to win.
author: Richard Bach

text: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
author: Satchel Paige

text: Success is not final; failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Love at first sight is easy to understand; it's when two people have been looking at each other for a lifetime that it becomes a miracle.
author: Amy Bloom

text: I know but one freedom and that is the freedom of the mind.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
author: Carl Jung

text: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer and practice it.
author: Richard Bach

text: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

text: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Our shared values define us more than our differences. And acknowledging those shared values can see us through our challenges today if we have the wisdom to trust in them again.
author: John McCain

text: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
author: Edmund Burke

text: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

text: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
author: P. Chidambaram

text: Technology is teaching us to be human again.
author: Simon Mainwaring

text: Two of man's basic needs are to love and to share. Both of these needs are satisfied in greater or lesser degree by friendship.
author: Mother Angelica

text: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

text: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
author: Mark Twain

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.

text: Remember that failure is an event, not a person.

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!

text: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.

text: I will prepare and someday my chance will come.

text: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.

text: Friendship is essentially a partnership.

text: It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.

text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.

text: Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.

text: I love my past. I love my present. I'm not ashamed of what I've had, and I'm not sad because I have it no longer.

text: An ounce of emotion is equal to a ton of facts.

text: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.

text: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgement.

text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.

text: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.

text: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.

text: Fear grows in darkness; if you think there's a bogeyman around, turn on the light.

text: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.

text: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

text: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.

text: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.

text: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.

text: It has become appallingly obvious that our technology has exceeded our humanity.

text: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches but reveal to them their own.

text: He that respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.

text: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only for wallowing in.

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.

text: Just as much as we see in others, we have in ourselves.

text: As a technology, the book is like a hammer. That is to say, it is perfect: a tool ideally suited to its task. Hammers can be tweaked and varied but will never go obsolete. Even when builders pound nails by the thousand with pneumatic nail guns, every household needs a hammer.

text: To be wrong is nothing unless you continue to remember it.

text: By going beyond your own problems and taking care of others, you gain inner strength, self-confidence, courage, and a greater sense of calm.

text: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.

text: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.

text: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; Unbelief, in denying them.

text: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.

text: When in doubt, don't.

text: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

text: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.

text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.

text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.

text: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.

text: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.

author: John Lennon

text: Quality is never an accident; it is always the result of intelligent effort.
author: John Ruskin

text: All that is necessary is to accept the impossible, do without the indispensable, and bear the intolerable.

text: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.

text: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.

text: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.

text: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
author: Confucius

text: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.

text: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
author: Aristotle

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: All the great performers I have worked with are fueled by a personal dream.

text: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
author: Richard Bach

text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

text: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.

text: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
author: Thomas Edison

text: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.

text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Cicero

text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.

text: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.

text: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.

text: You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.

text: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.

text: Those who are blessed with the most talent don't necessarily outperform everyone else. It's the people with follow-through who excel.

text: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.

text: It's so simple to be wise. Just think of something stupid to say and then don't say it.

text: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
author: Cicero

text: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

text: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.

text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.

text: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.

text: Don't wait. The time will never be just right.

text: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.

text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.

text: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.

text: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.

text: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.

text: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.

text: Every friendship goes through ups and downs. Dysfunctional patterns set in; external situations cause internal friction; you grow apart and then bounce back together.

text: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was within me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

text: Любовь? Что такое любовь? Любовь мешает смерти. Любовь есть жизнь. Все, все что я понимаю, я понимаю только потому, что люблю. Все есть, все существует только потому, что я люблю. Все связано одною ею. Любовь есть Бог, и умереть — значит мне, частице любви, вернуться к общему и вечному источнику.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Детей не отпугнешь суровостью, они не переносят только лжи.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Мы знаем, что с заряженными ружьями надо обращаться осторожно. А не хотим знать того, что так же надо обращаться и со словом. Слово может и убить, и сделать зло хуже смерти.
author: Лев Толстой

text: У меня от Думы три впечатления: комичное, возмутительное и отвратительное. Комичное в том понимании, какое оттенял Шопенгауэр, то есть противоположное естественному, нужному. Вот как если упал человек, когда он должен идти и не падать. Делается именно то, чего не нужно делать. Комичное, потому что мне все кажется, будто эти дети играют во взрослых. Ничего нового, оригинального и интересного нет в думских прениях. Все это слышано-переслышано. Никто не выдумал и не сказал ничего своего. У депутатов все перенято с европейского, и говорят они по-перенятому, вероятно, от радости, что у них есть «кулуары», «блоки» и прочее и что можно все это выговаривать. Наша Дума напоминает мне провинциальные моды. Платья и шляпки, которые перестали носить в столице, сбываются в провинцию, и там их носят, воображая, что это модно. Наша Дума — провинциальная шляпка. Возмутительным в ней кажется то, что, по справедливым словам Спенсера, особенно справедливо для России: все парламентские люди стоят ниже среднего уровня своего общества и вместе с тем берут на себя самоуверенную задачу разрешить судьбу стомиллионного народа. Наконец, Дума отвратительна — по грубости, неправдивости выставляемых мотивов, ужасающей самоуверенности, а главное, озлобленности. Такая Дума никому не нужна.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Дело не в том чтобы знать много, а в том, чтобы знать из всего того, что можно знать, самое нужное.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Сумасшедшие всегда лучше, чем здоровые, достигают своих целей, Происходит это оттого, что для них нет никаких нравственных преград, ни стыда, ни справедливости, ни даже страха. (Дневник)
author: Лев Толстой

text: Степень правдивости человека есть указатель степени его нравственного совершенства.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Физический труд не только не исключает возможность умственной деятельности, не только улучшает ее достоинство, но поощряет ее.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Я умер — я проснулся. Да, смерть — пробуждение!
author: Лев Толстой

text: Если дикарь перестал верить в своего деревянного бога, то это не значит того, что Бога нет, а только то, что Бог не деревянный. (Суратская кофейня)
author: Лев Толстой

text: Если человек научился думать, — про что бы он ни думал, — он всегда думает о своей смерти.
author: Лев Толстой

text: В мечте есть сторона, которая лучше действительности; в действительности есть сторона лучше мечты. Полное счастье было бы соединение того и другого.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Ценность жизни обратно пропорциональна квадрату расстояния до смерти.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Если можно признать, что бы то ни было важнее чувства человеколюбия, хоть на один час и хоть в каком-нибудь одном, исключительном случае, то нет преступления, которое нельзя бы было совершать над людьми, не считая себя виноватым.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Все люди живут и действуют отчасти по своим мыслям, отчасти по мыслям других людей. В том, насколько люди живут по своим мыслям и насколько по мыслям других людей, состоит одно из главных различий людей между собою.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Люди часто гордятся чистотой своей совести только потому, что они обладают короткой памятью.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Жизнь есть неперестающее изменение: ослабление плотской и усиление, увеличение духовной жизни.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Ничто так не ослабляет силы человека, как надежда в чем-либо, кроме своего усилия, найти спасение и благо.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Для того чтобы продолжать жить, зная неизбежность смерти есть только два средства; одно — не переставая так сильно желать и стремиться достижению радостей этого мира, чтоб всё время заглушать мысль о смерти, другое — найти в этой временной жизни, короткой или долгой, такой смысл, который не уничтожался бы смертью.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Все истины — парадоксы. Прямые выводы разума ошибочны, нелепые выводы опыта — безошибочны.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Если ты ещё не дошёл до той степени, когда тебе представляются две истины противоречащими одна другой, ты ещё не начинал мыслить.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Нет того негодяя, который, поискав, не нашел бы негодяев в каком-нибудь отношении хуже себя и который поэтому не мог бы найти повода гордиться и быть довольным собой.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Счастье есть удовольствие без раскаяния.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Человек, думающий о смерти со страхом, подобен путешественнику, заехавшему за океан и со страхом думающему о возвращении домой. Может быть и качка, и морская болезнь, и буря, а не миновать ворочаться домой.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Жизнь истинная — есть только та, которая продолжает прошедшую, содействует благу жизни современной и благу жизни будущей.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Старость — самая большая неожиданность в жизни.
author: Лев Толстой

text: Как можно надеяться, что на земле воцарится мир и процветание, если наши тела являются живыми могилами, в которых погребены убитые животные?
author: Лев Толстой

text: Сила правительства держится на невежестве народа, и оно знает это и потому всегда будет бороться против просвещения. Пора нам понять это.
author: Лев Толстой

author: Лев Толстой
